instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 8.19v no light
threads.message: Hello, I have a Macbook Air 2017 with no light and 8.19v on PPBUS. Some liquid around SMC. Replaced and rewired <RESISTOR>R5513</RESISTOR> that had some corrosion under it. So far I have tried 5-6 different SMC with same result, 8.19v and no light. Is there another condition beside a bad SMC that can pull down the PPBUS to 8.19v? I have 3.44 on <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 8.19v no light
threads.message:
Did you check <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>?
Also be sure to get 12MHz at Y5110.
If you don't have o-scope, at least check DC voltage at Y5110 pins.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 8.19v no light
threads.message: Damn been fixing macs since 2016 and overlooked <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>..... :eek:. <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR> was off and some corrosion on pin 1, replacing it fixed it. Thanks! The forum is so valuable even u been fixing for a while :).
